intro: Navarretia aggregata, commonly known as the clustered navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of mustard plants. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Navarretia aggregata is known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions and is often found in coastal areas.
